radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal, with no evidence of free air under the diaphragm.

Complete absence of the infrahepatic inferior vena cava with extensive retroperitoneal collateralization; atrophic left kidney. Right renal vasculature appeared patent. No renal stones, thickening of the bowel wall, or bowel dilatation observed.
Thrombus in the left iliac vein; no evidence of mesenteric or renal vein thrombosis.
Renal and mesenteric vasculature patent; clot seen in the left ascending lumbar vein.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: During the next several days, pain and renal function improved, leading to complete resolution at the 2-month follow-up visit.
